title: Analysis of Educational Effects and Strategic Design for the Taiwanese Romanization System (TGR/TMR)

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental Linguistics Concepts and Understanding of Taiwanese Culture/History
context.additional_context: Course focusing on practicing elementary teachers comparing the educational effectiveness of Taiwanese Romanization (TGR/TMR) and developing applicable teaching strategies, designed for fragmented learning in mobile environments

learning_goals: One can establish comparative criteria for educational effectiveness by analyzing the structural differences between TGR (Text-to-Graphic Representation) and TMR (Text-to-Multimedia Representation) notations.

Learners will identify three or more difficulty factors in Romanization learning (pronunciation, spelling, rule complexity) and apply two teacher-student interaction strategies (feedback methods, questioning techniques) to real-class scenarios for evaluation.
One can propose a TGR/TMR instructional design framework suitable for mobile microlearning environments.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
